definition: to intersperse comic remarks (in a performance)/(fig.) to quip/to banter
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
jest/nickname
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
to intersperse comic dialogue (as they do in operas)

sentences.english: The clown panicked the audience with a gag.
sentences.chinese: 小丑插科打诨逗得观众大笑。

sentences.english: Percussion performances contrast, gag, noise called into play.
sentences.chinese: 表演时锣鼓烘托，插科打诨，喧呼成戏。

sentences.english: The actor gagged up his part in the comedy.
sentences.chinese: 这个演员在所“扮演”的喜剧角色中插科打诨。

sentences.english: The young man would always cut up if there were any girls.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人一遇到姑娘总是插科打诨。

sentences.english: Jack likes to cut up in class.
sentences.chinese: 杰克喜欢在上课的时候插科打诨。

sentences.english: They ll tease you because you re different, or for no good reason.
sentences.chinese: 他们打诨你由于你差别，而在没有更好理由。

sentences.english: Each gag was rewarded with a generous belly-laugh.
sentences.chinese: 每一次插科打诨都引来一阵开怀大笑。

definition: to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
jest/nickname
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to play stupid/to act like an idiot
to quarrel/to bicker/glib repartee
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
dirty jokes/jokes of a visceral nature
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
(dialect) to joke
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
talkative/garrulous/loquacious/flippant/jocular
all smiles/smiling mischievously or ingratiatingly
to make an unreasonable scene
to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
